article:

| image=File:Hoedhuette.jpg symbolism=purity, nobility, , emptiness, ghosts,
| snow, ice, heaven, Caucasian, peace, , light, life, surrender, clouds, frost,
| milk, good, cotton, angels, weakness, protagonist, winter, innocence,
| sterility, coldness
 |r=255|g=255|b=255| |c=0|m=0|y=0|k=0| |h=-|s=0|v=100 |source=By definition }}
 'White' is the color of fresh milk and snow. It contains all the wavelengths of
 visible light without absorption, has maximum brightness, and does not have any
 hue. See Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 5th Edition (2002); "of the
 colour of fresh milk or snow." See also Webster's New World Dictionary of
 American English, Third College Edition, (1988): "Having the color of pure snow
 or milk." See also The Random House College Dictionary of the English Language,
 Revised Edition,(1980) It is the opposite of black. Shorter Oxford
 English Dictionary, 5th Edition (2002)

According to surveys in Europe and the United States, white is the color most
often associated with innocence, perfection, the good, honesty, cleanliness, the
beginning, the new, neutrality, lightness, and exactitude. Eva Heller
(2000), Psychologie de la couleur- effets ets symboliques, pg. 130-146
headings: The Middle Ages and the Renaissance
